revision.text:
{{Use dmy dates|date=December 2019}} {{infobox UK place| | country = England | coordinates = {{coord|52.391|-1.878|display=inline,title}} | official_name = Hollywood | population = 4,279 | population_ref = {{cite web|url=http://neighbourhood.statistics.gov.uk/dissemination/LeadKeyFigures.do?a=7&b=6098551&c=Hollywood+and+Majors+Green&d=14&e=15&g=498980&i=1001x1003x1004&m=0&r=1&s=1248819156281&enc=1|title=Key Figures for 2001 Census: Key Statistics|accessdate=28 July 2009}}
''Hollywood and Majors Green ward'' | static_image_name = Douglas Road, Hollywood - geograph.org.uk - 175732.jpg | static_image_caption = Douglas Road | shire_district = [[Bromsgrove (district)|Bromsgrove]] | shire_county = [[Worcestershire]] | region = West Midlands | civil_parish = Wythall | constituency_westminster = | postcode_district = B47 | postcode_area = B | post_town = BIRMINGHAM | dial_code = 0121 | os_grid_reference = SP081772 | london_distance = }} '''Hollywood''' is a large village in the [[Bromsgrove (district)|Bromsgrove district]] of [[Worcestershire]], England, almost contiguous with and to the south of the city of [[Birmingham]]. The village lies across the wards of Hollywood & Majors Green{{cite web|url=http://www.nomisweb.co.uk/reports/lmp/ward2011/1140856811/report.aspx |title=Office for National Statistics ward maps: Hollywood |accessdate=4 August 2012}}{{cite web |url=http://www.worcestershire.gov.uk/cms/pdf/Census_Wards_BardsBromsHollywood.pdf |title=Worcestershire County Council Ward Profile |accessdate=21 March 2010 |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110605014159/http://www.worcestershire.gov.uk/cms/pdf/Census_Wards_BardsBromsHollywood.pdf |archivedate=5 June 2011 }} and Drakes Cross & Walkers Heath{{cite web|url=http://www.nomisweb.co.uk/reports/lmp/ward2011/1140856807/report.aspx |title=Office for National Statistics ward maps: Drakes Cross |accessdate=4 August 2012}} and is located within the civil parish of [[Wythall]].{{cite web|url=http://www.worcestershire.gov.uk/cms/images/Census_OldParish_Wythall.jpg|title=Worcestershire County Council Historic Parish Maps: Wythall|format=JPG|accessdate=4 August 2012|url-status=dead|archiveurl=http://webarchive.nationalarchives.gov.uk/20120906081911/http%3A//www.worcestershire.gov.uk/cms/images/Census_OldParish_Wythall.jpg|archivedate=6 September 2012}} The southern part of the village is also known as Drakes Cross whilst the eastern part is sometimes referred to as Trueman's Heath. Hollywood is situated in the extreme northeastern corner of Worcestershire, 8.5 miles / 13 km south of Birmingham city centre, 6 miles / 9.5 km west-southwest of [[Solihull]] and 9 miles / 14.5 km northeast of [[Redditch]]. ==History== Until the 1950s, Hollywood was a rural area with many fields and farms. Extensive postwar development saw these fields and farms give way to housing estates, shops and schools. ==Geography== Hollywood is served by the Alcester Road, although the [[A435 road]] itself which formerly ran through the village now bypasses it, and is adjacent to [[Highter's Heath]] to the north and [[Wythall]] to the south. Other settlements close by include [[Kings Heath]], [[Kings Norton]], [[Shirley, West Midlands|Shirley]] and [[Dickens Heath]]. ==Amenities== Hollywood is home to the 18-hole Hollywood Golf Club, formerly known as Gay Hill Golf Clubhttp://www.gayhillgolfclub.co.uk/ Accessed 25 November 2017[https://www.teeofftimes.co.uk/courses/-4273-hollywood-golf-club-details teeofftimes] Accessed 25 November 2017 since 1913,https://www.facebook.com/pg/hollywood.golf.club/about/?ref=page_internal Accessed 25 November 2017 and a family owned and managed packaging company, Kilby Packaging, which has existed since 1946. Most of the village's community buildings are centred around [[Woodrush High School]] and the adjacent Coppice Primary School on Shawhurst Lane. These include the Woodrush Sports Centre, Community Hub and Wythall (parish) Library, whilst [[St Mary's Church, Wythall|St Mary's CoE Church]], originally located on Chapel Lane in Wythall, now occupies a new building adjoining the Coppice School. Hollywood Primary School is located just over the county border within the Highter's Heath area of the city of Birmingham ==Notable residents== *[[John Taylor (bass guitarist)|John Taylor]] from the band [[Duran Duran]]. *[[Alan Smith (footballer, born 1962)|Alan Smith]] former [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]] and [[Leicester City F.C.|Leicester City]] striker. *[[Parry Glasspool]], [[Hollyoaks]] actor. *[[Steve Ashley]], former motor racing champion.(Class 4 Kart, formula ford, F3) *[[Alan Dedicoat]] former presenter at BBC Radio WM and now voice of the Balls on [[The National Lottery]]. *Morgan Harley, athlete {{cite web|url=https://www.instagram.com/p/B6REqfVAhg3qQaOvnAGZlBFmFFmktu2Y4T6XlY0/|title=Instagram|publisher=}} ==References== {{Reflist}} {{Commons category}} {{Bromsgrove}} {{authority control}} [[Category:Villages in Worcestershire]] {{Worcestershire-geo-stub}}
